content: One famous building constructed in the Beaux-Arts style is the Grand Central Terminal in New York City. It was completed in 1913 and is considered a masterpiece of the style. The terminal features a monumental façade with a grand entrance adorned with a 50-foot-tall clock, along with ornate details and sculptures. The interior of the station features a main concourse with a vaulted ceiling and marble floors, along with many other ornate details such as sculptures and murals. The Grand Central Terminal is a prime example of the Beaux-Arts style's emphasis on grandeur, symmetry, and ornamental decoration.
